StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Exome Sequencing in Families with Overt and Subclinical Orofacial Cleft Phenotypes: CIDR

Person.Organization: EMORY UNIVERSITYUNIVERSITY OF IOWAUNIVERSITY OF PITTSBURGH AT PITTSBURGH

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Funding for this study was provided by the National Institutes of Health: R00DE025060, R01DE016148, R01DE09886, R01DE012472, P50DE016215, R37DE008559, R01DE014667, and R01DD000295. Sequencing services were provided by the Center for Inherited Disease Research (CIDR), which is funded through a federal contract from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) to the Johns Hopkins University (HHSN268201700006I).
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Data use limitations vary by consent group and are as follows: 1) General Health/Medical/Biomedical Research, 2) Orofacial birth defects and related phenotypes, 3) Craniofacial and Eye Disorders, or 4) Craniofacial Research. Data use for a given consent group must be consistent with the described data use limitations. Methodological research to improve knowledge of how genetic factors play a role in the etiology of oral clefts (or other conditions, depending on the data use limitations) is permitted for some of these datasets.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Orofacial birth defects and related phenotypes, MDS, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-OBDR-MDS-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Orofacial birth defects and related phenotypes and related disorders. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
Includes related diseases and phenotypes such as medical and dental data, speech characteristics, images and derived data (e.g. 3D facial measures, ultrasounds of the upper lip), and all other physical assessments taken on the study subjects.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Orofacial birth defects and related phenotypes, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-OBDR-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Orofacial birth defects and related phenotypes and related disorders.
The data can be used for studies related to craniofacial development including clefts of the face, lip, or palate and the normal human facial developmental processes that include those structures.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
Studies that may or may not be related to craniofacial development or disorders.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Craniofacial Research)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CFR
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Craniofacial Research.
